reviewText:
Well, I really liked this game, despite the weird physics and connection problems.

It's really fun just to wander around Hawaii with the top of your cabrio down, checking your garage with the cars parked, buying houses, driving miles and miles to find the secrets, etc.

Actually, it was the first Arcade Racing game I liked.

The detail level of the cars interiors are outstanding and some of the races are GIANT (the final race on each island take aprox. 1 hour, and that's a lot for a non Gran Turismo Enduro).

Oh, and you will need a controller to play. You can play with the keyboard, but some of the Driving License tests are nearly impossible with the keyboard (but are really easy with the controller).

Positive:
+ Lots of licensed Cars
+ GIANT maps (aprox. 1 real hour to lap around the first island)
+ Cool interaction with the cars in the garage/dealer (open doors, turn on indicator, opening door windows, honking, test-drive, etc)
+ Very detailed car models
+ The Arcade style driving is actually fun and not stupid-impossible like some other famous games

The negative points:
- Last time I played all the bikes were DLC (you can test-drive them though)
- The voice acting and humans models are dreadful  (that's ok with me, not the focus at all)
- There's only 2 radios and they're both annoying (I used to turn the music off and playing something better on my stereo)
- There's some bizarre physics acting (especially in high-speeds)

I've only played TDU2 a couple of hours but i think i've seen enough to recommend it.

And the multiplayer is pretty dead. You can meet people in free roam but i've not managed to start a single multiplayer race.

TDU2 is a game that is best played with friends so if you can gather some of your friends i'd recommend you to buy it!
If you prefer to roam around solo, i would recommend it as well!
However, if you are looking to play som MP races with random people you may want to reconsider and maybe check the TDU2 forums first, for some friendly people!

reviewText:
I have been patient enough with this game. Before even thinking about buying this piece of crap, please read this.
Pros:
1. Great vehicle models
2. Awesome environment
And that's about it.
Cons:
1. Voice acting out of a ♥♥♥♥ing flea market
2. Every, I mean EVERY car feels heavy in the rear, resulting in an unrealisting tendency to lose control at launch and slight corners.
3. The penalty system is ♥♥♥♥ed up.
4. DLCs. Not meant to make the game more enjoyable, just to squeeze more money out of the players.
5. Unreliable servers. you could be Co-driving with someone and suddenly get teleported to a different server.
6. A few hours into the game and you'd be asking if the handling could get any worse and the physics engine would completely screw up. HOW IS A KERB ABLE TO BRING YOU TO A COMPLETE STOP!?
7. Soundtrack is crap.

Racing purists, be warned. This is a game made by people who do not know how cars work. Heck, they still think gravity is magic. You can expect to smash up your computer in.... 5 hours... provided you were stupid enough to buy this crap. I've already gone through five PCs and this one's falling apart. This isn't a racing game, this is a rage game.

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

Seriously, this game is so buggy its not even funny.  It looks like it has pretty good game play, but I seriously can't play it. The problem this game has is that it doesn't want to load sections fast enough, leaving you waiting up to 5 seconds on a FROZEN screen...


NOT ACCEPTABLE

The game play actually looked fun.  It had some real RP, kind of like Need for Speed: Undercover, but you actually got to move around.  This game is inbetween Undercover and free world games like GTA.


GET A BETTER GAME

If you like the trailer or screenshots, I would suggest you get Need for Speed: Undercover for an fun EXTREMELY fun alternative, or DiRT (1, 2, or 3) for the best racing experience on the PC.  If you have those games, its still BETTER TO LEAVE THIS GAME ALONE, COLD, IN THE DARK!

Seriously, I'm completely ticked at Atari...

reviewText:
DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!

Seriously, this game is so buggy its not even funny.  It looks like it has pretty good game play, but I seriously can't play it.  (Just for reference, my rig plays DiRT 3 on the highest settings, 1080p no problem ~30-60FPS).  The problem this game has is that it doesn't want to load sections fast enough, leaving you waiting up to 5 seconds on a FROZEN screen...


NOT ACCEPTABLE

The game play actually looked fun.  It had some real RP, kind of like Need for Speed: Undercover, but you actually got to move around.  This game is inbetween Undercover and free world games like GTA.


GET A BETTER GAME

If you like the trailer or screenshots, I would suggest you get Need for Speed: Undercover for an fun EXTREMELY fun alternative, or DiRT (1, 2, or 3) for the best racing experience on the PC.  If you have those games, its still BETTER TO LEAVE THIS GAME ALONE, COLD, IN THE DARK!

Seriously, I'm completely ticked at Atari...

reviewText:
Pros:
-Cruising is fun and relaxing as hell.
-The wide selection of vehicles is definitely a plus.
-There are many, many hours of roads to drive on and many secrets to discover.

Cons:
-The races aren't challenging in the slightest.
-The physics are absolutely horrid.
-The police chase system is beyond broken.
-EMPs that shut your car down for several seconds.
-Cops that drive the opposite direction to ram you head-on every 3 seconds.
-Said physics give cops seemingly infinite mass allowing them to knock your ♥♥♥♥ around.
-Going offroad leads to helicopters that can arrest you from the air without any ground forces.
-You can be arrested even while doing 80kmph.
-Terrible voice acting/character models. This wouldn't be an issue if a decent portion of the game wasn't centered around your in-game avatar.
-Your in-game cell phone CONSTANTLY rings telling you to do certain tasks. If you're just cruising, tough ♥♥♥♥.
-The launcher of the game is EXTREMELY temperamental. Some times the game launches, but most of the time you'll receive an error and a crash report.

reviewText:
I have been patient enough with this game. Before even thinking about buying this piece of crap, please read this.
Pros:
1. Great vehicle models
2. Awesome environment
And that's about it.
Cons:
1. Voice acting out of a ♥♥♥♥ing flea market
2. Every, I mean EVERY car feels heavy in the rear, resulting in an unrealisting tendency to lose control at launch and slight corners.
3. The penalty system is ♥♥♥♥ed up.
4. DLCs. Not meant to make the game more enjoyable, just to squeeze more money out of the players.
5. Unreliable servers. you could be Co-driving with someone and suddenly get teleported to a different server.
6. A few hours into the game and you'd be asking if the handling could get any worse and the physics engine would completely screw up. HOW IS A KERB ABLE TO BRING YOU TO A COMPLETE STOP!?
7. Soundtrack is crap.

Racing purists, be warned. This is a game made by people who do not know how cars work. Heck, they still think gravity is magic. You can expect to smash up your computer in.... 5 hours... provided you were stupid enough to buy this crap. I've already gone through five PCs and this one's falling apart. This isn't a racing game, this is a rage game.

reviewText: Never too late to warn people away from a bad game. I got this when it originally came out and, at first, had some fun. However, the emphasis on online play, the buggy engine, the twitchy driving, and the purely frustrating races eventually overcame whatever fun factor I thought was present. This is a tedious game - the open world that they tout is boring and half is copied from the previous game. Controls are terrible - a tap in the wrong direction can spell disaster, especially on the missions to bring the car intact somewhere on the island. The free driving can be fun, but is ultimately pointless - there's little to see and few things to do. If this is on a sale and you really love racing games and its dirt cheap, grab it for a few hours of fun. Otherwise, give this one a big miss.

reviewText:
After 40 hours, depression ensues
This is a hard one to recommend
we all know the circumstances that lead to Atari releasing this unfinished sequel to a very solid game
Be that as it may, under the right state of mind you might want to give it a try, no doubt that would be indicated to small minority of gamers

Pros:
For an open world racing game, it's packed. There is enough content for way more than 40 hours
There are 2 impressively sized maps, various car dealers, hairdressers, clothing shops, houses, sticker shops. All this expand it and turn it into much more then just a racing game
For single player, theres career mode with 5 different types of events. Theres side missions, Dlc missions, you can spend your time exploring locations, taking photos or finding car wrecks.
Joining or creating MP events wont be easy, as expected, not that there are people still playing, i always came across 7 players in each map, granted they don't have any other choice then to play online
Both cars and locations look fairly decent, the interiors of the vehicles are incredibly detailed
Its also fairly cheap
Cons: (where to begin)
I dont even know how to describe the plot is. Its...you know how GTA is a Satire? well, TDU2 is the exact opposite.
Have you ever wanted to race against Paris Hilton and her friends? yeah...me neither. The fact that your character takes part in this consumerist culture is baffling
Character animations are terrible
awful voice actors, that seem to have recorded their lines by phone
Inconsistent Physics
Some objects have the wrong hitbox size
Some of the vehicles can only be unlocked with real money, all of the motorcycles have to be unlocked with real money, there's a casino that also requires, you guessed it, real money, all that locked content put together is far more expensive then the game itself
Some locations have absolutely nothing other than grass, i hope you like the colour green
No good music
Some of the side missions make zero sense
Dumb AI, not being able to provide you a challenge is not even the biggest issue, having missions that require you to follow someone and AI is so broken they cant even find the right road, now that's a big problem
Traffic can't spawn when you drive over 300 km/h
necessary to change controller settings, it's practically unplayable has is

You know what? This is not even half of it, there is no debate here,  just avoid this game

reviewText:
I have a lot of nostalgic memories when I played this on the Xbox. Now that I have it on PC, I can re-live those memories once again.

But enough nostalgia, let's talk about TDU2.

Test Drive Unlimited 2 is an open-world racing game set in Ibiza (and Oahu once you've progressed enough).

I like to think of it as a racing RPG, as you can level up your character, and gain special perks, such as discounts, new haircuts, cars, etc.

But in the end, where it really shines is in its multiplayer. You drive around with others in a game session, and they can challenge you to races, hang out in your house, and even make a club with you!

In the end, I recommend this very much.

reviewText:
Recommended for sure... and why?

Well, it's an open world racing game. You've got acces to a big stash of cars, which you obviously have to buy with the in-game money you make. The cars themselves are very detailed, extrior and intrior.

The roads you can ride on are big and amazing. Every country has it's own style (Ibiza, (Spain) and Hawaii). There are a lot of side activities to do, so that you can earn a good load of money and buy your dream car.

Although there won't be any new updates, the game works pretty fine and has some DLC cars (where you have to pay for (Atari coins)).

Like every game it has it's weak spots, and there are still things unfinished, bugged, missing etc.. But overall this game is still, anno 2014, worth buying it.

reviewText:
At the time I would of reccomended this game, other racing games had nothing on this game. This game was THE BEST racing game in my opinion.

Then after a few years this game started becoming worse, the devs stopped updating the game servers got closed and reopened, it was all over the place.

I came back to this game after a few years of not playing it, hoping that I would get the sam experience I did when I first got it. Not the case at all.

Booting the game is fine, I had a few issues with my account but that's not the games fault.

The gameplay wasn't like I remembered it, the game use to run smooth, it was so easy to play. Now, I get atleast 5 FPS playing it, there are fixes out there but I have no idea if they will actually work or not.

I honestly miss this game. This game (IF they kept updating it and kept it alive) could of been NFS Killer, I played nothing BUT this game, I didn't even consider playing NFS while I had this game.

I really hope that they fix this game now, this was the best racing game of its time.

reviewText: Test Drive Unlimited 2 offers an exceptionally beautiful and detailed representation of both Ibiza and Hawaii. The choices are endless and the gameplay is slick, addictive and keeps you coming back for more. Completing challenges keeps the game valid and interesting. The enonomy system in the game adds a nice twist by allowing the player to progress through a scale of ten levels based on their current speed and driving skill (any colisions reduce the bank back to zero). This encourages better driving and allows you to build up money quite easily. Cars and houses can be purchased too. All in all, TDU2 is an exceptional game

reviewText:
Possibly the best racing game out there. The thing that makes this game so much better than the rest is the freedom you get. The world is massive, containing two islands; Ibiza and Hawaii, both with full asphalt and dirt roads, so if driving on paved roads gets a little boring, you can change it up a bit and go offroading. There are quite a few cars in the game, which means that there is a fair amount of variety when choosing your car(s).

There are a few problems with the game. There is no option for a clutch without a racing wheel, so you can only go automatic or sequential. I highly recommend getting a gamepad because some of the cars will slide about with the arrow keys. Also when compared to Test Drive Unlimited (prequel), the police in this are suicidal. In TDU they simply try to surround you and bring you to the side of the road, whereas in this the objective is to ram you until you are stuck between a tree and 3 cops, and have to give up.

Otherwise the game is brilliant. Definitely recommend buying it if you are into racing games.
